titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Paul H. Clyde papers, 1972

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Typed transcript of an oral history interview conducted by University Librarian, Benjamin Powell, circa November 1972, with penciled corrections by Professor Clyde. Subjects include the history department, Duke's presidents from Few to Knight, the Summer Session, the University Committee on Long-Range Planning, the development of Canadian and Commonwealth Studies, the Gross-Edens Affair, and the Duke Endowment. Folder also includes cover letter and oral history contract.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Paul H. Clyde papers, 1972, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Paul H. Clyde was a specialist in Far Eastern history and wrote several textbooks. He served as Director of the Summer Session at Duke from 1950-1960 and was a member of the staff of The Duke Endowment from 1961-1969. He came to Duke in 1937, retired in 1961, and died in 1998.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Typed transcript of an oral history interview conducted by University Librarian, Benjamin Powell, circa November 1972, with penciled corrections by Professor Clyde. Subjects include the history department, Duke's presidents from Few to Knight, the Summer Session, the University Committee on Long-Range Planning, the development of Canadian and Commonwealth Studies, the Gross-Edens Affair, and the Duke Endowment. Folder also includes cover letter and oral history contract.

note.label: General note
note.p: This folder resides in Small Collections, kept on-site. Please consult Archives staff for more information.

note.label: General note
note.p: This transcript is open for use. The reel-to-reel tape was discarded for reasons unknown.

controlaccess.corpname: Duke University. University Committee on Long-Range Planning
